text:
I just pushed my initial commit of Napari.jl if anyone is interested:
<https://github.com/mkitti/Napari.jl>

elements.text: I just pushed my initial commit of Napari.jl if anyone is interested:

text: I've always wanted to do something like that!! :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: I've always wanted to do something like that!!

text: Oh wait :smile: This is just a wrapper around an existing Python library! Well, still pretty dope, but not what I wanted to do :wink:

elements.text: This is just a wrapper around an existing Python library! Well, still pretty dope, but not what I wanted to do

text: Yea, it is built around a Python package for multidimensonal image viewing. It's funded by the Chan  Zuckerberg initiative, so it is not something I necessarily want to take head on right now.

elements.text: Yea, it is built around a Python package for multidimensonal image viewing. It's funded by the Chan  Zuckerberg initiative, so it is not something I necessarily want to take head on right now.

text: Very cool. It's probably not very much to add much of that visible functionality to Julia (and ImageView already has a good bit of it), but there's only so much time in the world so it makes sense.

elements.text: Very cool. It's probably not very much to add much of that visible functionality to Julia (and ImageView already has a good bit of it), but there's only so much time in the world so it makes sense.

text:
Julia actually adds quite some functionality to it via multiple dispatch. We can figure out quite a lot about an image by its type. The Python calls are named argument soup:
<https://napari.org/docs/0.4.0/api/napari.layers.image.html>

elements.text: Julia actually adds quite some functionality to it via multiple dispatch. We can figure out quite a lot about an image by its type. The Python calls are named argument soup:

text: One interesting difference is that Napari uses QT whereas ImageView.jl uses Cario and Gtk. While we have QML.jl, we actually don't have direct QT bindings at the moment.

elements.text: One interesting difference is that Napari uses QT whereas ImageView.jl uses Cario and Gtk. While we have QML.jl, we actually don't have direct QT bindings at the moment.

text: I haven't looked at QML closely. I do wonder if we're missing out of anything.

elements.text: I haven't looked at QML closely. I do wonder if we're missing out of anything.
